basics.name: Andreas Kasprzok
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Polyglot technologist excited about building scalable, resilient and available services and infrastructure. Highly autonomous and outcome-driven with a passion for observability.

work.name: Massdriver
highlights: Key contributor to the core Massdriver platform, enabling the deployment of hundreds of resources every day ranging from Kubernetes clusters to services on all three major clouds using a variety of provisioners
Evangelized Massdriver’s value to customers via webinars and blog posts
Spearheaded the development of Massdriver’s metrics product, scraping over 50 million metrics from AWS, Azure, and GCP

work.name: BlockFi
highlights: Promoted from Senior Engineer to Tech Lead after demonstrating ability to cut through team silos to horizontally align the engineering organization around reliability and availability goals for the platform
Built a team and observability stack that watched over billions of dollars in crypto deposits and served a 500-strong engineering org across 3 continents

work.name: Autonomic
highlights: Promoted from Software Engineer to Senior Software Engineer based on exceptional performance and ownership of key services

Developed and operated cloud services that enable all current generation Ford vehicles to perform gigabyte-sized OTA updates, send hundreds of megabytes of telemetry per day, and execute commands remotely

publications.name: An ant-inspired model for multi-agent interaction networks without stigmergy
Dash Designer: A Multi-Modal Design Tool for Vehicle Interactivity
publications.summary: We present Dash Designer: a mixed-reality design tool for vehicle interiors. The tool consists of a tablet and projector that can be used to create and organize new interactive components for vehicle dashboards. A user can use a freehand sketching interface to draw a new interactive element on the tablet, and a simple set of gestures to motion the created item onto a real dashboard. A simple interface is provided to connect the created components to vehicle data published by an integrated driving simulator. The system is currently a work in progress, and future work will include integration with real vehicle dashboards, autonomous vehicles, and support for participatory design sessions.

publications.name: Decentralized Congestion Control in Random Ant Interaction Networks
Decentralized traffic rerouting using minimalist communications
